page.title: 02VERNHAM STREET & LITTLEDOWN
page.content: Vernham Street & Littledown are probably the oldest part of the district as the church & the Tudor Manor House are in the vicinity. Littledown is a hamlet with old flint & brick houses, a pub The Boot,and a small chapel in which services are held once a week. The social activities are all integrated with Vernham Dean in the village Hall. There is a small riding school and farm with several acres of grazing land. A smallholding with 15 acres rearing calves and sheep and the remainder of the hamlet is private residential housing. Vernham Dean, now the main village, was probably very much smaller because the meaning of 'dean' is 'the valley of'. Vernham Street was probably the main village 400 years ago.
